reference: Volume Four, Issue Forty, File 8 of 14
title: BT Tymnet
historical_context: This article provides an in-depth look at BT Tymnet, a major telecommunications network service in the early 1990s, highlighting its global reach and technical specifications.
target_audience: Telecommunications professionals, network engineers, hackers interested in legacy systems, and security researchers.
short_summary: This article details the BT Tymnet network, including access locations, service classifications, and technical specifications for connecting to various regional networks. It serves as a comprehensive guide for users and professionals looking to understand or utilize the Tymnet service.
summary:
In this first part of a three-part series, Toucan Jones introduces readers to BT Tymnet, a significant player in the telecommunications landscape of the early 1990s. The article outlines the access location index for various countries, providing abbreviations and contact numbers for users looking to connect to the network. It also discusses the integration of BT Tymnet with Regional Bell Operating Companies, detailing how users can access these networks through various dial-up options. The article serves as a practical guide for users navigating the complexities of connecting to Tymnet's services, emphasizing the importance of understanding terminal identifiers and login options for optimal performance.

Furthermore, the article categorizes the types of services offered by BT Tymnet, including database and timesharing companies utilizing the network. It highlights the global reach of Tymnet, showcasing its connections across multiple countries and the diverse applications available, from business communications to educational resources. This foundational knowledge is crucial for anyone interested in the historical context of telecommunications and the evolution of network services, making it a valuable read for both technical professionals and enthusiasts of hacker culture.
